poem:
Title: "Cycle of Refuge"

An elite cyclist of golden quest,
Bounded by fear, on asylum nest. 
Sweat-kissed medals, yet displaced,
To a barge with no bike embraced. 
The wheels of dreams shadowed by plight,
Speak of a world not quite right. 
Mohammad rides, in spirit so ripe,
Freedom's journey, no tangible bike.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Elite cyclist seeking UK asylum told he must move to Bibby Stockholm barge A gold medal-winning elite cyclist who is seeking asylum in the UK fears his career will be derailed because he has been told by the Home Office he must move to the Bibby Stockholm barge and cannot take his bike on board. Mohammad Ganjkhanlou, 26, an Iranian, has won four gold, two silver and six bronze medals in big competitions and has". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
